dsa.algorithms.sort

Class CountingSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • dsa.algorithms.sort.CountingSort

  • public class CountingSort
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains sort methods which are implemented using Counting Sort.

    The methods in this class all throw a NullPointerException, if the specified array reference is null, except where noted.

    Counting sort is generally only ever used if k isn’t larger than n; in other words, if the range of input values isn’t greater than the number of values to be sorted.

    Time Complexity(Best) Time Complexity(Average) Time Complexity(Worst) Space Complexity
    Ω(n + k) θ(n + k) O(n + k) O(n + k)

    • Method Detail

      • sort

        public static void sort(char[] a,
                        char c)
        Sorts the specified array into ascending/descending order based on the character input.
        Parameters:
        a - the array to be sorted
        c - if(c == 'a' || c == 'A') then sort a in ascending order, if(c == 'd' || c == 'D') then sort a in descending order
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if((c != 'a' || c != 'A') && (c != 'd' || c != 'D'))

      • sort

        public static void sort(char[] a,
                        int fromIndex,
                        int toIndex,
                        char c)
        Sorts the specified range of array into ascending/descending order based on the character input.
        Parameters:
        a - the array to be sorted
        c - if(c == 'a' || c == 'A') then sort a in ascending order, if(c == 'd' || c == 'D') then sort a in descending order
        fromIndex - the index of the first element, inclusive, to be sorted
        toIndex - the index of the last element, exclusive, to be sorted
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if((c != 'a' || c != 'A') && (c != 'd' || c != 'D'))
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if(fromIndex > toIndex)
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if(fromIndex < 0 || toIndex > a.length)

      • sort

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if((c != 'a' || c != 'A') && (c != 'd' || c != 'D'))

      • sort

        public static void sort(int[] a,
                        char c)
        Sorts the specified array into ascending/descending order based on the character input. If the range(min to max) is greater than array size then OutOfMemoryError is thrown.
        Parameters:
        a - the array to be sorted
        c - if(c == 'a' || c == 'A') then sort a in ascending order, if(c == 'd' || c == 'D') then sort a in descending order
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if((c != 'a' || c != 'A') && (c != 'd' || c != 'D'))

      • sort

        public static void sort(int[] a,
                        int fromIndex,
                        int toIndex,
                        char c)
        Sorts the specified range of array into ascending/descending order based on the character input. If the range(min to max) is greater than array size then OutOfMemoryError is thrown.
        Parameters:
        a - the array to be sorted
        c - if(c == 'a' || c == 'A') then sort a in ascending order, if(c == 'd' || c == 'D') then sort a in descending order
        fromIndex - the index of the first element, inclusive, to be sorted
        toIndex - the index of the last element, exclusive, to be sorted
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if((c != 'a' || c != 'A') && (c != 'd' || c != 'D'))
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if(fromIndex > toIndex)
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if(fromIndex < 0 || toIndex > a.length)
